item.title: Pakistan International Airlines passenger plane crashes in Karachi
item.description: A PIA jet crashes in a residential area on a flight from Lahore, with around 100 people on board.

item.title: NPC: China moves to impose controversial Hong Kong security law
item.description: Pro-democracy activists fear Beijing pushing through a new law could be "the end of Hong Kong".

item.title: Trump removes mask before facing cameras at car factory
item.description: The president says he didn't want to "give the press the pleasure of seeing" him in a face covering.

item.title: Singapore quizzer finally wins $10k after Tony Hadley's message
item.description: Muhammad Shalehan was originally denied the prize as judges claimed he mispronounced "Tony Hadley".

item.title: How bumble bees trick plants into flowering early
item.description: It's the first time scientists have observed this behaviour, which bees do when pollen is scarce.

item.title: Wilson Jerman: Ex-White House butler dies with coronavirus
item.description: Wilson Roosevelt Jerman worked for 11 US presidents in over five decades at the White House.

item.title: Jamal Khashoggi: Fiancée rejects family forgiveness offer to killers
item.description: The prominent Saudi journalist was murdered inside the Saudi consulate in Istanbul in October 2018.

item.title: Son 'kills father' during Zoom video chat in New York state
item.description: Several chat participants witness the stabbing of a Long Island man by his son, police say.

item.title: Ahmaud Arbery: Third man charged over death of black jogger
item.description: The motorist is accused of murder and attempted false imprisonment over the shooting in Georgia.

item.title: Augustin Bizimana: Remains of top Rwanda genocide suspect found
item.description: Augustin Bizimana was defence minister when about 800,000 people were killed in 100 days.

item.title: Cyclone Amphan: Survivors return to face destruction left by storm
item.description: A massive clean-up operation begins after the storm flattened homes and left cities without power.

item.title: French healthcare workers fined at Paris hospital protest
item.description: Police say the crowd of more than 400 people was breaching social distancing rules.

item.title: Lana Del Rey responds to accusations of racism
item.description: The singer named several women of colour while making a point about music industry double standards.

item.title: Coronavirus: Could there be a second wave?
item.description: What factors determine a potential second wave of Covid-19 infections?

item.title: 'Sharks everywhere': Angler films feeding frenzy in Australia
item.description: An Australian fisherman says he was stunned to come across dozens of sharks feeding in shallow waters.

item.title: Coronavirus in Africa: Ghana WW2 veteran in Covid-19 fundraiser
item.description: Private Joseph Hammond is fundraising for frontline workers and vulnerable veterans across Africa.

item.title: Quiz of the Week: How did the Queen fare on the rich list?
item.description: How closely have you been paying attention to what's been going on during the past seven days?

item.title: Keith Urban on his lockdown drive-in concert
item.description: The US country music star performed to healthcare workers in their cars in Tennessee.

item.title: Africa's week in pictures: 15 - 21 May 2020
item.description: A selection of the week's best photos from across the continent.

item.title: How will UK pay for the coronavirus damage?
item.description: Coronavirus has cost the UK government hundreds of billions of pounds. How will we pay for it?

item.title: Tiger seized in Mexico after man tried to lasso it
item.description: Animal welfare officials intervened after a video emerged showing men chasing the tiger in the streets.

item.title: Coronavirus: How world leaders adapted to the pandemic
item.description: From shaking hands to working from home, how has life changed for those at the top?

item.title: Miami riots 1980: My friend was killed by my colleagues
item.description: After four white policemen were acquitted of killing a black man, Miami descended into chaos in 1980.

item.title: Harry Potter first edition found in skip sells for £33,000
item.description: An expert says the hardback Philosopher's Stone first edition is "the Holy Grail" for collectors.

item.title: Lockdown: South African actors create a hit online soap opera
item.description: A group of South African actors in lockdown are making a hit online soap opera from their homes.

item.title: Coronavirus: The Bolivian orchestra stranded in a German castle
item.description: The young musicians have been in a moated castle in eastern Germany for 73 days after Bolivia closed its borders.

item.title: Coronavirus: Is Latin America the next epicentre?
item.description: New cases have been rising sharply in Brazil and Mexico, along with other countries in the region.

item.title: 'We'd be taken more seriously if we were aggressive'
item.description: They may be festival headliners, but LA sisters Haim say people underestimate them as a band.

item.title: Coronavirus sparks a sanitary pad crisis in India
item.description: Schools normally provide students with pads in a country where millions of women go without.

item.title: Get ready for the 'holy grail' of computer graphics
item.description: Ray tracing produces stunning lighting effects but has been too complex for computers, until now.

item.title: Coronavirus: Sleepless nights for doctors in a war zone
item.description: People in Afghanistan dared to hope for peace, but they are now fighting both violence and the virus.

item.title: Coronavirus: What does it mean for natural disaster response?
item.description: How are emergency services preparing for natural disasters amid the coronavirus pandemic?

item.title: Doctor who raised concerns over PPE shortage admitted to mental hospital
item.description: The Andhra Pradesh medic was suspended after complaining about the lack of protective equipment.

item.title: Man Utd reveal £28m cost of coronavirus - and expect figure to rise
item.description: Manchester United say the coronavirus pandemic has cost them an initial £28m - and expect the final figure to be far higher.

item.title: Did Jordan go too far? Or was he a great leader? Amaechi and Syed debate
item.description: Former NBA player John Amaechi and journalist Matthew Syed debate on BBC Radio 5 Live whether Michael Jordan's leadership techniques in The Last Dance crossed the line.

item.title: Henry? Keane? Aguero? Drogba? Pick your combined title-winning XI
item.description: You have spent the last few days selecting your premier League-winning XIs from the clubs who have won it twice, now it's time to pick your ultimate combined XI.

item.title: 'Everyone is going to suffer' - how coronavirus has hit lower-league football
item.description: BBC Sport looks at the impact of coronavirus on lower league football clubs, players and fans, and how the game might recover.

item.title: Virgil van Dijk: Vincent Kompany says Liverpool defender Premier League's best ever
item.description: Former Manchester City skipper Vincent Kompany tells Football Focus why he thinks Liverpool's Virgil van Dijk is the Premier League's best ever defender and a worthy title winner.

item.title: 'Welcome, erm, Jaap Stam?' - FC Cincinnati use wrong photo in new manager tweet
item.description: Jaap Stam is the new FC Cincinnati manager, but the MLS club used a photo of someone else on social media to announce his arrival.

item.title: Plinofficial: Russian rapper who loved dollars arrested by FBI
item.description: A cash-flaunting rapper from Siberia came to the US to become a global star. Where did it go wrong?
